page.title: 06FARMING 2
page.content: chose these breeds because they give big calves which put on weight rapidly.There are also sheep - Cheviot ewes and Suffolk rams: rearing fat lambs for sale. The livestock have 29 acres of grazing 28 of which are rotation grass. The remaining 24 acres are under crops - barley, grass (for hay) and turnips mainly to provide winter feeding for the animals. However if quality and price are right the barley may be sold to a malting firm in Inverness. Kincraig Farm (GR 694702) is a large mixed farm and is worked by the owner and three full-time employees. The farm carries 150 cross-Hereford beef cows which are served by Charollais bulls. Again these breeds produce large calves which are reared for 1-2 years before being sold for further fattening.
